author: Elastic
description: Identifies a successful login to the AWS Management Console by the Root user.
false_positives: It's strongly recommended that the root user is not used for everyday tasks, including the administrative ones. Verify whether the IP address, location, and/or hostname should be logging in as root in your environment. Unfamiliar root logins should be investigated immediately. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule.
name: AWS Management Console Root Login
note: The AWS Filebeat module must be enabled to use this rule.
query: event.dataset:aws.cloudtrail and event.provider:signin.amazonaws.com and event.action:ConsoleLogin and aws.cloudtrail.user_identity.type:Root and event.outcome:success
